intro: Uroskinnera hirtiflora var. hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered uroskinnera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough texture, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as scrublands and rocky areas.
